intro: Lotononis persica, commonly known as Persian lotononis, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while the flowers are small and clustered in a head. It is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its delicate appearance.
